main event: A civilian reported seeing two yellowish lights in the sky in Irvington, New York, on February 26, 1968.
interesting points: The larger light was described as being twice as bright as a bright star., The smaller light pulsated at various times during the observation., The objects traveled from the southwest to the northwest., The observer estimated the sighting lasted about 5 minutes., The conclusion drawn was that the sighting was possibly due to a hot air balloon.
witness description: civilian observer who reported the sighting
